name: Autumn Butternut Squash and Wheat Berry Salad
author: PalouseBrand
summary: The orange vinaigrette adds just the right pop to the glorious fall flavors of butternut squash, red wheat berries, and cranberries.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups hard red winter wheat berries
2 cups butternut squash cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan and add wheat berries
Reduce heat to low, cover, and let cook until soft, 45 to 50 minutes
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Toss squash with 1 tablespoon oil and place on a baking sheet
Roast in the preheated oven until tender, 20 to 30 minutes
Transfer squash to a paper towel-lined plate to soak up excess oil and let cool
Meanwhile, mix orange juice, remaining oil, maple syrup, and orange zest together in a bowl for vinaigrette
Combine cooked wheat berries, roasted squash, vinaigrette, parsley, and cranberries together in a large bowl
Let cool in the refrigerator, 10 to 20 minutes
Top salad with sliced almonds and serve
